WorkItem.Description:
This error comes and goes.  Seems to be related to whenever Blizzard put up one of their "intermediate" pages (in this case yet another mount of some description) but that is only a shot in the dark.
 
What is annoying is that this type of advert is a relatively common event but RAWR seems to fall over it everytime.
 
RAWR isn't a bad tool, excluding the fact that many of the models are of questionable accuracy and functionality, but not taking care of simple things like this make it look weak.
 
Pretty stupid when a whole host of other web-tools seem to be able to deal with this trivial event but RAWR falls on its face.
 
Nothing else fails. wow-reforge loads data, SimC loads data, Armory is accessible successfully from a web-browser. I guess RAWR is just fragile?
 
For the record (though it has been reported many times before) here is the rather useless error message:
 
The remote server returned an error: (503) Server Unavailable.
 
Stack Trace:
 
   at System.Net.HttpWebRequest.EndGetResponse(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
   at System.Net.WebClient.GetWebResponse(WebRequest request, IAsyncResult result)
   at System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsResponseCallback(IAsyncResult result)
WorkItem.Summary: Yet again: The remote server returned an error: (503)

Comments.Message: I continue to have the exact same issue. I've uninstalled, reinstalled, run as an administrator, disabled my firewall.. and nothing changes. No problem accessing Battle.net or any other sites. Help!?
This has nothing to do with Blizzard adverts. It also has nothing to do with Rawr directly, it's a problem on the web hosting side.
